p: Among individuals developing bnAbs, a small fraction of patients (1%) called elite neutralizers, develop very broad and highly potent bnAbs able to neutralize isolates of various subtypes in vitro [ 27, 36]. Since 2009, thanks to the development of single-cell-based antibody cloning techniques, a large number of bnAbs with outstanding breadth and potency have been generated from these elite neutralizers [ 37, 38, 39, 40]. Passive transfer studies with bnAbs in nonhuman primates have demonstrated effective protection against simian/human immunodeficiency virus (SHIV) [ 41, 42, 43]. The bnAbsâ€™ functionality lies in their ability to bind and clear both cell-free viruses and infected cells [ 44, 45].
